item.title: Gatech CS 1301 Computing in Python I
item.author: Author
item.description: Chapter 1.1: Computing Programming Vocabulary -Code: Commands given to a computer in order to perform a task. -Line of code: A single command. -Program: A collection of lines of code that serve one or more overall functions. -Input (files, user input, websites) ðŸ‘‰ code ðŸ‘‰ output (files, screen, sound) -Compile: Reading over code and looking for errors. (proofreading by compilers) -Run: When the program is actually executed. Compiling just makes sure what we told the program to do makes sense; running checks whether the program actually do what we want it to do.
